assignee_default.description: Who to assign tickets to in the case that auto-assignment wouldn't work. This does NOT mean that all tickets will be assigned to this user. This is a fallback option. To enable/disable auto assignment for an agent, please do so in the user profile settings.

allow_registrations.description: Allow users to register on the support page. This setting can be enabled even though the WordPress setting is disabled. Currently, registrations are not allowed by WordPress.

tickets_per_page_front_end.description: How many tickets per page should be displayed to the customer/client/end-user?

replies_order.description: In which order should the replies be displayed (for both client and admin side)?

replies_per_page.description: How many replies should be displayed per page on a ticket details screen?

hide_closed.description: Only show open tickets when agents click the "All Tickets" link.

show_count.description: Display the number of open tickets in the admin menu.

old_ticket.description: After how many days should a ticket be considered «old»?

multiple_agents_per_ticket.description: Show the two extra agent fields on the ticket?

show_secondary_agent_in_ticket_list.description: Show the secondary agent in the ticket list?

show_tertiary_agent_in_ticket_list.description: Show the Tertiary agent in the ticket list?

show_third_party_fields.description: Show the third party fields on the ticket?

show_third_party_01_in_ticket_list.description: Show Third Party #1 Data in the Ticket List?

show_third_party_02_in_ticket_list.description: Show Third Party #2 Data in the Ticket List?

channel_show_in_ticket_list.description: Show Channel Field In Ticket List? (Channel allows you to select where a ticket originated - web, email, facebook etc.)

ticket_submit.description: The page used for ticket submission. This page should contain the shortcode [ticket-submit]

ticket_list.description: The page that will list all tickets for a client. This page should contain the shortcode [tickets]

terms_conditions.description: Terms & conditions are not mandatory. If you add terms, a mandatory checkbox will be added in the registration form. Users won't be able to register if they don't accept your terms

credit_link.description: Do you like this plugin? Please help us spread the word by displaying a credit link at the bottom of your ticket submission page.

theme.description: Which theme to use for the front-end.

theme_stylesheet.description: Load the theme stylesheet. Don't uncheck if you don't know what this means

frontend_wysiwyg_editor.description: Show a editor editor for the ticket description when user submits a ticket.

use_email_template.description: Outgoing notifications are styled with a built-in template. If you are using an e-mail templating plugin you should deactivate this option.

enable_confirmation.description: Do you want to activate this e-mail template?

enable_assignment.description: Do you want to activate this e-mail template?

enable_reply_agent.description: Do you want to activate this e-mail template?

enable_reply_client.description: Do you want to activate this e-mail template?

enable_closed.description: Do you want to activate this e-mail template?

enable_closed_client.description: Do you want to activate this e-mail template?

enable_attachments.description: Do you want to allow your users (and agents) to upload attachments to tickets and replies?

attachments_max.description: How many files can a user attach to a ticket or a reply?

filesize_max.description: What is the maximum size allowed for one file (in MB)? Your server allows up to 1024M

login_page.description: Only use this option if you know how to create your own registration page, otherwise you might create an infinite redirect. If you need help on creating a registration page you should start by reading this guide.

admin_see_all.description: Administrators can see all tickets in the tickets list. If unchecked admins will only see tickets assigned to them.

agent_see_all.description: Agents can see all tickets in the tickets list. If unchecked agents will only see tickets assigned to them.

ticket_topic_slug.description: What to use for the indivdual ticket slug.  The default is the ticket topic transformed into a slug.

delete_data.description: Delete ALL plugin data on uninstall? This cannot be undone.

assignee_default.description: Who to assign tickets to in the case that auto-assignment wouldn't work. This does NOT mean that all tickets will be assigned to this user. This is a fallback option. To enable/disable auto assignment for an agent, please do so in the user profile settings.

show_tertiary_agent_in_ticket_list.description: Show the Tertiary agent in the ticket list?

channel_show_in_ticket_list.description: Show Channel Field In Ticket List? (Channel allows you to select where a ticket originated - web, email, facebook etc.)

ticket_submit.name: Ticket Submission
ticket_submit.description: The page used for ticket submission. This page should contain the shortcode [ticket-submit]

ticket_list.name: Tickets List
ticket_list.description: The page that will list all tickets for a client. This page should contain the shortcode [tickets]

terms_conditions.name: Content
terms_conditions.description: Terms & conditions are not mandatory. If you add terms, a mandatory checkbox will be added in the registration form. Users won't be able to register if they don't accept your terms

credit_link.name: Show Credit
credit_link.description: Do you like this plugin? Please help us spread the word by displaying a credit link at the bottom of your ticket submission page.

theme.name: Theme
theme.description: Which theme to use for the front-end.

theme_stylesheet.name: Theme Stylesheet
theme_stylesheet.description: Load the theme stylesheet. Don't uncheck if you don't know what this means

frontend_wysiwyg_editor.name: Use editor in front-end
frontend_wysiwyg_editor.description: Show a editor editor for the ticket description when user submits a ticket.

use_email_template.name: Use Template
use_email_template.description: Outgoing notifications are styled with a built-in template. If you are using an e-mail templating plugin you should deactivate this option.

enable_confirmation.name: Enable
enable_confirmation.description: Do you want to activate this e-mail template?

content_confirmation.name: Content
content_confirmation.default:
Hi {client_name},

Your request (#{ticket_id}) has been received, and is being reviewed by our support staff.

To add additional comments, follow the link below:

View Ticket

or follow this link: {ticket_link}

Regards,
{site_name}

enable_assignment.name: Enable
enable_assignment.description: Do you want to activate this e-mail template?

content_assignment.name: Content
content_assignment.default:
Hi {agent_name},

The request {ticket_title} (#{ticket_id}) has been assigned to you.

View Ticket

or follow this link: {ticket_admin_link}

Regards,
{site_name}

enable_reply_agent.name: Enable
enable_reply_agent.description: Do you want to activate this e-mail template?

content_reply_agent.name: Content
content_reply_agent.default:
Hi {client_name},

An agent just replied to your ticket "{ticket_title}" (#{ticket_id}). To view his reply or add additional comments, click the button below:

View Ticket

or follow this link: {ticket_link}

Regards,
{site_name}

enable_reply_client.name: Enable
enable_reply_client.description: Do you want to activate this e-mail template?

content_reply_client.name: Content
content_reply_client.default:
Hi {agent_name},

A client you are in charge of just posted a new reply to his ticket "{ticket_title}".

View Ticket

or follow this link: {ticket_admin_link}

Regards,
{site_name}

enable_closed.name: Enable
enable_closed.description: Do you want to activate this e-mail template?

content_closed.name: Content
content_closed.default:
Hi {client_name},

Your request (#{ticket_id}) has been closed by {agent_name}.

Regards,
{site_name}

enable_closed_client.name: Enable
enable_closed_client.description: Do you want to activate this e-mail template?

content_closed_client.name: Content
content_closed_client.default:
Hi {agent_name},

The ticket (#{ticket_id}) has been closed by {client_name}.

Good job!
